questions.question: Factor completely: $6t^2 - 19t - 7$
questions.explanation: Using the AC method ($6 \times -7 = -42$), we split $-19t$ into $-21t + 2t$. Factoring by grouping gives $(3t + 1)(2t - 7)$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $4z^2 + 19z + 12$
questions.explanation: The factors of $48$ that add to $19$ are $16$ and $3$. Grouping $4z^2 + 16z + 3z + 12$ results in $(4z + 3)(z + 4)$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $x^2 + 14x + 49$
questions.explanation: This is a perfect square trinomial since $7^2 = 49$ and $2(x)(7) = 14x$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $4w^2 - 25$
questions.explanation: This is a difference of squares: $(2w)^2 - 5^2 = (2w - 5)(2w + 5)$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $81x^2 - 36x + 4$
questions.explanation: This is a perfect square trinomial: $(9x)^2 - 2(9x)(2) + 2^2 = (9x - 2)^2$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $x^4 - 81$
questions.explanation: Factor once as $(x^2 - 9)(x^2 + 9)$, then factor the first binomial again to get $(x - 3)(x + 3)(x^2 + 9)$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $3x^3 - 12x^2 - 15x$
questions.explanation: First factor out the GCF $3x$. Then factor the remaining trinomial $x^2 - 4x - 5$ into $(x - 5)(x + 1)$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $10x^2 - 11x - 6$
questions.explanation: Using the AC method ($AC = -60$), split $-11x$ into $-15x + 4x$. Grouping gives $(5x + 2)(2x - 3)$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $2x^2 + 12x + 18$
questions.explanation: Factor out the GCF 2 to get $2(x^2 + 6x + 9)$. This is a perfect square trinomial: $2(x + 3)^2$.

scoreMessages.90: Brilliant! You've successfully synthesized all factoring methods to simplify rationals.
scoreMessages.70: Good job. Remember to factor completely before attempting to cancel.
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing. Be carefulâ€”you can only cancel factors (multiplication), not individual terms (addition).
scoreMessages.0: Review all factoring types. Simplifying rationals requires mastery of GCF, trinomials, and squares.
